unnormalised: Okay, so you're asking about how much veggies and stuff we *actually* buy, right? Well, let me tell you, it depends if Amma's the one doing the shopping. If she is, brace yourselves!
normalised: Okay, so you're asking about how much veggies and stuff we actually buy, right? Well, let me tell you, it depends if Amma's the one doing the shopping. If she is, brace yourselves!

unnormalised: First off, she'll buy like, 5 kg of potatoes. Why? Because "aloo sabzi is versatile," even though we had it 3 times last week. And don't even get me started on onions. She'll pick out each one individually, making sure they’re all exactly 75 g each, I swear! Then she’ll haggle with the vendor for like, ₹2 per kg. "It’s the principle, beta!"
normalised: First off, she'll buy like, five kilogram of potatoes. Why? Because "aloo sabzi is versatile," even though we had it three times last week. And don't even get me started on onions. "It’s the principle, beta!"

unnormalised: Next up, tomatoes. If they're selling for less than Rs. 20/kg, she gets a whole crate. "So cheap! Make tomato chutney!" as if we have time to make buckets of chutney every week. And then there’s the coriander. Must be 2 bunches, specifically measured as 30 cm long each, no more, no less, and only the brightest green ones!
normalised: Next up, tomatoes. If they're selling for less than rupees twenty per kilogram, she gets a whole crate. "So cheap! unnormalised: Don’t forget the "a little bit of everything else." Which translates to 1/2 kg each of bhindi, baingan, and some weird leafy green I can’t even pronounce, probably good for "iron." God help you if you forget the 250 g of ginger, precisely! It's for the chai, obviously.
